results.title: The Heights
results.creator_credit: Matchbox Pictures, For Pete's Sake Productions, Peta Astbury and Warren Clarke
results.brief_description: A groundbreaking serial about a community trying to protect its way of life, while under the constant threat of gentrification and the social stratification of its neighbourhood.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Matchbox Pictures, For Pete’s Sake Productions, Peta Astbury and Warren Clarke

results.title: The Hecklers
results.brief_description: Politicians under pressure during the 1966 election campaign in Britain. The camera goes to meetings up and down the country with an eye to angry and excited audiences. Suggests the heat, rather than the light, of a campaign. It is crammed with off-beat observation and fascinating side-lights on the techniques of leading politicians.

results.title: The Heavens are telling
results.brief_description: Part of the BBC Open University television series “From Copernicus to Darwin”. The program begins with Dr Colin Russell’s brief review of the heavens as known to the Babylonian astronomers, and continues with his description of the classical conceptions of the Universe held by the Pythagoreans and Plato, Eudoxus and Aristotle. He then examines the explanation of heavenly motion; discusses the conflict of the pantheistic idea that the heavens themselves were divine, and an alternative idea - that the Universe is a machine whose intricacy and immensity testified to the goodness and glory of God who created it. He finally moves on to Copernicus’ theory of a heliocentric Universe setting the scene for the Copernican revolution.

results.title: The Heatwave lasted four days
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A few meters of film, the tempting lure of several thousand dollars, and a television-news cameraman with a weakness for wine, women and cars becomes an accomplice in crime. In this fast-moving murder feature, which links intrigue with intrigue, we witness the progressive ruination of a man who can find no way out.

results.title: The Heartbreak Kid
results.brief_description: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the course of her life until she begins at Hartley High and meets aspiring soccer player, 17-year-old Nick (Alex Dimitriades)…

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

results.description: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek-Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the traditional course of her life. She begins teaching at an inner-city working-class school and she finds her ideas challenged by the students. Involving herself in a campaign by a group of non-anglo students to form a soccer club in a school where the racist PE teacher only supports Australian Rules Football, Christina starts falling in love with aspiring soccer player, 17 year old Nick (Alex Dimitriades). The ensuing affair forces Christina to challenge herself, her family and the culture she lives in. Managing to effectively combine comedy with a refreshing examination of contemporary ethnic relationships in Australia, beautifully acted by a young cast, and insightfully scripted.
description_for_label: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a school teacher from a wealthy Greek-Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the traditional course of her life. She begins teaching at an inner-city working-class school and she finds her ideas challenged by the students. Involving herself in a campaign by a group of non-anglo students to form a soccer club in a school where the racist PE teacher only supports Australian Rules Football, Christina starts falling in love with aspiring soccer player, 17 year old Nick (Alex Dimitriades). The ensuing affair forces Christina to challenge herself, her family and the culture she lives in. Managing to effectively combine comedy with a refreshing examination of contemporary ethnic relationships in Australia, beautifully acted by a young cast, and insightfully scripted.

results.title: The Heartbreak kid
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Ben Gannon and View Films Production
results.brief_description: Christina (Claudia Karvan) is a schoolteacher from a wealthy Greek-Australian background, engaged to a lawyer and content with the traditional course of her life. She begins teaching at an inner-city working-class school and she finds her ideas challenged by the students. Involving herself in a campaign by a group of non-anglo students to form a soccer club in a school where the racist PE teacher only supports Australian Rules Football, Christina starts falling in love with aspiring soccer player, 17 year old Nick (Alex Dimitriades). The ensuing affair forces Christina to challenge herself, her family and the culture she lives in. Managing to effectively combine comedy with a refreshing examination of contemporary ethnic relationships in Australia, beautifully acted by a young cast, and insightfully scripted, “The Heartbreak Kid” is a breakthrough film in an Australian film culture for too long dominated by narrow colonialist ideology. Based on the play by Richard Barrett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Jenkins, Ben Gannon and View Films Production

results.title: The Heart: how it works
results.brief_description: Shows the structure of the heart, and how it serves as a pump for the circulation of blood. Explains methods for testing and examining, showing the stethoscope, and analyses the sound cycles by which this instrument works. Concludes with some startling facts about the ordinary workload of the heart.

results.title: The Heart of the matter: the decline of traditional cultural values
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Illustrates how changing values and economic pressures are influencing popular culture and traditional values. Profiles a young salesmanager in women’s fashion, who is estranged from her family and communist values and compares a female rock singer with a former star of the Peking Opera. The second part of the program looks at some of the pressures on rural families resulting from the new materialism and rapid economic growth. A range of people voice their concerns about the decline of traditions and the danger of losing the soul of China in the rush for economic and social change.

results.title: The Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts for Life”.
Examines the demands placed upon the heart and lungs, demonstrated by treadmill experiments in the laboratory. Shows that causes of heart diseases are aggravated by over-eating and lack of exercise and that lung damage can be caused by smoking and air pollution.
